data.title: I-House 2024 Celebration & Awards Gala
data.meta_description: International House is proud to honor members of our global community who, in their personal and professional lives, promote a world of greater justice and peace. The 2024 Celebration and Awards Gala will highlight the contributions of the following individuals: Chenming Hu (IH 1969-71) recipient of the Global Impact Award for his contributions to the semiconductor industry
data.text:
I-House Celebration & Awards Gala

A festive evening celebrating valued members of our global community and honoring their support and service to I-House. We enjoyed the food of award-winning Executive Chef Abigail Serbins and the entertainment provided by the very talented residents of International House. View and share our Press Release and blog post: Our Vibrant Home Glows: The Return of the I-House Gala

Thursday, March 21, 2024

5:00 PM Music & Mingling | 6:00 PM Dinner & Program

Chevron Auditorium International House Berkeley

2299 Piedmont Avenue, Berkeley, CA

Ticket Pricing:

$275 per person

$200 per person for Young Diplomats (35 years of age and under)

$150 per person to sponsor a current I-House resident

Please note that the initial $65 of each ticket purchase goes toward event food and beverage and is not tax deductible.

Event and Table Sponsorships

2024 Gala Honorees

International House is proud to honor members of our global community who, in their personal and professional lives, promote a world of greater justice and peace. The 2024 Celebration and Awards Gala will highlight the contributions of the following individuals:

Chenming Hu (IH 1969-71)

Global Impact Award

For his contributions to the semiconductor industry which have led to transformative improvements in computing and communications around the globe.

Chenming Hu is the TSMC Distinguished Professor Emeritus of UC Berkeley, where he taught electrical engineering for 40 years and invented the 3D transistor that powers today’s smartphones, 5G, and AI chips. For advancing the semiconductor technology and industry, he received the National Medal of Technology and Innovation from President Obama in 2016 and the Taiwan Presidential Science Prize in 2023. He is a recipient of UC Berkeley’s highest honor for teaching – the Berkeley Distinguished Teaching Award. He also taught at MIT, served as the CTO of TSMC, authored five books and more than 1,000 research articles, and has a portfolio of 150 US patents. Chenming Hu and Margaret Leung met at I-House in 1970 and married in 1972.
